Instructions for installing dependencies and configuring apache for the ReFlow Django project.

# Installation

1.  Install Ubuntu 12.04 LTS ([http://www.ubuntu.com/download/server](http://www.ubuntu.com/download/server)). **Note: Amazon has an EC2 instance for 12.04.**

1.  Update system packages

    `apt-get upgrade`

1.  Install Apache and mod-wsgi

    `apt-get install apache2`

    `apt-get install libapache2-mod-wsgi`

1.  Install NumPy, matplotlib, and SciPy

    `apt-get install python-numpy`

    `apt-get install python-matplotlib`

    `apt-get install python-scipy`

1.  We need Mercurial and pip to get the latest py-fcm

   `apt-get install mercurial`

   `apt-get install python-pip`

1.  Install py-fcm from the Mercurial repository. **Note: Do not pip install fcm. You will get errors due to the missing logicle.h file.**

    `pip install hg+https://code.google.com/p/py-fcm/#egg=fcm`

1.  Use pip to install Django so we get version 1.4. (You'll get v1.3 using apt-get)

    `pip install django`

1. Install Django app dependencies

    `pip install django-extensions`

    `pip install django-tastypie`

1.  Install git to get ReFlow

    `apt-get install git`

1.  Clone ReFlow (for now, just put this somewhere like your home directory, we'll move it later)

    `git clone https://github.com/whitews/ReFlow.git`

### Optional, but recommended

*   Install iPython (always nice to have)

    `apt-get install ipython`

*   Install sqlite3 (more convenient for development)

    `apt-get install sqlite3`
